reasoning: Xeroderma pigmentosum (XP) is a rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder affecting DNA repair. Estimated incidence <0.01 per 100k or approximately 1 per 1 million people. Well-characterized condition with documented cases but very low population incidence. Data primarily from genetic registries and case reports.
source: Genetic disease registries and epidemiological case reports (2000-2005)
